title: Ex-Thomas Cook chief to run new IBM arms
text:
YouTube stars make inroads into films 
The launch of the two divisions follows 13 consecutive quarters of falling revenues at IBM, as the company hives off lower margin hardware businesses to focus on faster growing ventures, including in cloud computing and data analysis. 
IBM said its new education unit was expected to launch this year, while Ms Green would lead a staff of 2,000 at its internet of things arm, which was created in March. 
John Kelly, a senior vice-president at IBM, said she brought “a strong, proven track record as a transformative leader” and “has consistently shown a deep understanding of the needs of her customers and clients, and how to help them achieve their goals and aspirations”. 
Ms Green said she was “honoured” to join the company, adding: “The internet of things will help enterprises and governments at every level unlock entirely new areas of opportunity and growth . . . likewise, education is being transformed by technology and IBM is incredibly well positioned to help leaders in the field enable this change.” 
Before Thomas Cook, Ms Green was chief executive of Premier Farnell, an electronic components distributor, and worked at Arrow Electronics, a US ‎supplier to computing companies. 
In June, it emerged that she would receive a bonus of £5.6m from Thomas Cook. 
Since her departure last November, the tour operator has struggled amid a public outcry over the deaths of two children — Bobby and Christi Shepherd, aged six and seven — who died from carbon monoxide poisoning on a Thomas Cook holiday in Corfu nine years ago. 
Ms Green was chief executive when the company tried to block an inquest into their deaths on the grounds that there was an ongoing trial in Greece. 
In response to the backlash over its handling of the tragedy, the company announced at the end of May that it would make a substantial donation to charities nominated by the children’s families. 
Ms Green also donated a third of her bonus to charities named by Bobby and Christi’s parents.
